meanings.sent1: I need to rebook my flight for next week.
meanings.sent2: She decided to rebook her hotel room for the following weekend.
meanings.sent3: After missing the train, he had to rebook his ticket and wait for the next one.
meanings.sent4: The author had to rebook his signing event due to unexpected circumstances.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to rebook your appointment if you can't make it on time.

meanings.sent1: They had to rebook their table at the restaurant for a later time.
meanings.sent2: The travel agent helped them rebook their vacation package.
meanings.sent3: The couple had to rebook their honeymoon trip due to a sudden change in plans.
meanings.sent4: She had to rebook her car rental after extending her stay.
meanings.sent5: Remember to rebook your hotel room if you decide to stay longer.

meanings.definition: A new booking made after a previous one was canceled
meanings.sent1: The airline offered a rebook for all passengers affected by the cancellation.
meanings.sent2: He received a rebook for the concert after the initial show was called off.
meanings.sent3: The hotel provided a rebook for the guests inconvenienced by the plumbing issue.
meanings.sent4: She requested a rebook for the workshop when the first session was rescheduled.
meanings.sent5: The rebook for the cruise was a pleasant surprise after the storm disrupted the original trip.
